summary: This document is a lengthy email from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio to various judicial and law enforcement officials, alleging widespread SEC corruption, obstruction, and facilitation of ongoing securities frauds. It focuses on market manipulation, illegal naked short selling, money laundering through OTC shell companies, and specific cases involving entities like Riot Blockchain, Virtu Financial, and individuals like Barry Honig. The author provides detailed analysis of trading volumes and SEC actions, claiming his whistleblower information has been ignored or suppressed.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the document, alleging extensive SEC corruption and securities fraud, providing detailed analysis of trading data and specific cases.

persons.name: Chad Everett Harris
persons.context: Supervised the construction of Whinstone's Rockdale, Texas data center; associated with Northern Data's transactions.

persons.name: Mathis Schultz
persons.context: Former private banker who founded Northern Data in 2015.

persons.name: Dougie Cifu
persons.context: Accused of knowingly lying about NITE/VIRT equity market making share volumes on a May 2021 earnings call to conceal illegal activity.

persons.name: Alex Kramm
persons.context: Had an exchange with Cifu on the Q1 2021 earnings call; the author challenges him to explain Cifu's lack of transparency.

persons.name: Joshua Sason
persons.role: Accused in SEC microcap fraud case
persons.context: Subject of a 2019 SEC action (NewLead) which the author claims is based on his information but not posted as award-eligible.

persons.name: John M. Fife
persons.context: Subject of a 2020 SEC action for dealing billions of penny stock shares; the author claims this is based on his information.

persons.name: Justin W. Keener
persons.context: Subject of a 2020 SEC action (JMJ Financial); the author claims this is based on his information.

persons.name: David Urban
persons.role: Trump PA Campaign Manager, NITE Board Member
persons.context: Linked to his own alleged money laundering shell, FSD Pharma, and a failed LOI with Therapix.

persons.name: Robert Eide
persons.context: Named in FINRA/SEC actions related to Aegis; his pension plan is noted as a seller in a SciSparc registration.

persons.name: Kevin McKenna
persons.context: Named in SEC action for aiding and abetting Aegis's violations.

persons.name: Barry Honig
persons.role: Prolific investor in alleged money laundering shells
persons.context: Central figure accused of controlling multiple money laundering shells like MGT Capital, Bioptix/RIOT, and Inergetics/Millenium.

persons.name: Mr. Gottschall
persons.context: Accused of conducting a grossly inadequate investigation into Riot Blockchain, failing to visit its HQ, and facilitating fraud.

persons.name: Brian Colleran
persons.context: Linked to a $20 million purchase agreement with Millennium Biotech and became a large shareholder; connected to Honig and Sason.

persons.name: Chad Readler
persons.role: Former DOJ prosecutor, now Federal Judge
persons.context: Was the prosecutor on the civil case against Colleran; appointed judge by Trump.

persons.name: Mark B. Fisher
persons.role: Owner of MBF Clearing and MBF Capital
persons.context: His entities were involved in a fraud 'acquisition' by Riot Blockchain; linked to Miami SEC Director Eric Bustilloe.

persons.name: Eric Bustilloe
persons.context: Called a 'grossly corrupt Piece of Shit' for alleged obstruction related to Mark Fisher's entities.

persons.name: Dmitry Akhanov
persons.context: Shown as an insider in Bioptix/Alphasniffer; linked to Russian entity Rusnano and Neophotonics board.

persons.name: Scott Shay
persons.context: On board of CardWorks; SBNY was escrow agent for Bioptix/RIOT offerings and linked to Trump/Kushner.

persons.name: Dan Kamensky
persons.context: His sentencing by Judge Cote is called a 'gross miscarriage of justice' linked to Ares Management/Handler.

persons.name: Jason Sunstein
persons.role: CFO of multiple OTC shell companies
persons.context: San Diego resident linked to Viper Networks, Santeon Group, and other shells allegedly known to SEC LA.

persons.name: Ashraf Rofail
persons.context: Linked to International Land Alliance and virtual offices in San Diego.

connections.description: Dilorio directly accuses Gottschall of SEC corruption, criminal obstruction, and conducting a sham investigation into Riot Blockchain.
Both are prolific figures in alleged money laundering schemes, with Sason showing up as a large holder in Honig-linked shell Inergetics.
Fife/Iliad was involved in MGT Capital (a Honig shell) just before its registration was revoked.
Both named in SEC/FINRA actions against Aegis Capital Corp for violations.
Urban is a 'Not So Independent Board Member' of NITE (Virtu Financial), linking him to Cifu's company.
Colleran entered a large purchase agreement with Millennium Biotech (a Honig-controlled shell) and became a large shareholder.
Implied connection where Fisher's 'Miami' link is suggested to involve corrupt SEC Director Bustilloe.
Akhanov (Rusnano USA) was an insider in Bioptix, which Honig/Stetson used as a vehicle to get into RIOT.

events.title: SEC Charges Joshua Sason et al.
events.description: SEC files charges in an elaborate microcap stock fraud case (NewLead). The author claims this action is based on his whistleblower information.

events.title: SEC Charges John M. Fife et al.
events.description: SEC charges John M. Fife and companies he controls for dealing over 21 billion shares of penny stock without registering as a dealer.

events.title: SEC Charges Justin W. Keener
events.description: SEC charges Justin W. Keener d/b/a JMJ Financial as an unregistered penny stock dealer.

events.title: SEC Ends Investigation into Riot Blockchain
events.description: Mr. Gottschall of the SEC Denver office ends investigation into Riot Blockchain without recommending enforcement, which the author calls a sham.

events.title: Virtu Financial Q1 2021 Earnings Call
events.description: CEO Dougie Cifu states April volumes were 'a hair under 10 billion shares per day,' which the author alleges is a blatant lie to conceal massive illegal naked shorting volumes.

events.title: Ongoing SEC Fraud and Obstruction
events.description: The author details ongoing securities fraud, money laundering, and SEC corruption throughout May 2021, involving multiple shell companies and trading activities.

locations: 7961 Shaffer Parkway Suite 5, Littleton, CO (Vista Gold HQ)
Chantilly, VA 20151-1750 (SEC Whistleblower mail address due to telework)
keyFacts: The author, Christopher J. Dilorio, alleges massive, ongoing SEC corruption and criminal obstruction in facilitating securities fraud, particularly involving illegal naked short selling and money laundering through OTC shell companies.

Riot Blockchain (fka Aspen Bio, Venaxis, Bioptix) is alleged to be a Honig/Stetson money laundering shell that only exists in SEC filings, with its reported headquarters being a co-location with an ISP and a Pakistani BPO entity.
SEC official Mr. Gottschall is accused of conducting a sham investigation into Riot Blockchain, ending it in January 2020 without ever visiting the alleged headquarters in Castle Rock, Colorado.

Virtu Financial (NITE) CEO Dougie Cifu is accused of knowingly lying about equity market making share volumes on a May 2021 earnings call to conceal that 80-90% of volumes came from illegal OTC trading.

Multiple SEC enforcement actions (Sason, Fife, Keener) are claimed by the author to be based on his whistleblower information, yet were not posted as award-eligible, indicating further SEC obstruction.
